newsitem.title: UK: Explosion reported at north English rail station.
newsitem.headline: Explosion reported at north English rail station.

text.p: Sky television reported an explosion at a railway station in the northern English city of Leeds on Friday, shortly after several stations were evacuated following telephoned bomb warnings.
There were no immediate reports of any injuries.

Suspected IRA bomb warnings had brought traffic chaos to northwest England early on Friday, when police were forced to close at least three railway stations and the main highway following telephoned bomb warnings.
Doncaster, Crewe and Stoke-on-Trent railway stations were evacuated and the M6 motorway closed off near the city of Manchester, cutting off Britain's main north/south road and rail links.
